trans-unit.source: Capacity planning for Hyper-V replication
trans-unit.target: Capacity planning for Hyper-V replication

trans-unit.source: This article contains instructions on how to use the capacity planner tool for Azure Site Recovery, and includes resources for capacity planning for Hyper-V replication
trans-unit.target: This article contains instructions on how to use the capacity planner tool for Azure Site Recovery, and includes resources for capacity planning for Hyper-V replication

trans-unit.source: Capacity planning for Hyper-V replication
trans-unit.target: Capacity planning for Hyper-V replication

trans-unit.source: Azure Site Recovery uses Hyper-V Replica for replication between two on-premises VMM sites or between an on-premise VMM server and Azure storage.
trans-unit.target: Azure Site Recovery uses Hyper-V Replica for replication between two on-premises VMM sites or between an on-premise VMM server and Azure storage.

trans-unit.source: This article contains step-by-step instructions on using the Capacity planner for Azure Site Recovery (ASR) - Hyper-V Replica tool.
trans-unit.target: This article contains step-by-step instructions on using the Capacity planner for Azure Site Recovery (ASR) - Hyper-V Replica tool.

trans-unit.source: The Capacity Planner for ASR - Hyper-V Replica tool guides an IT administrator in designing the server, storage, and network infrastructure that is required to successfully deploy Hyper-V Replica and to validate network connectivity between two sites.
trans-unit.target: The Capacity Planner for ASR - Hyper-V Replica tool guides an IT administrator in designing the server, storage, and network infrastructure that is required to successfully deploy Hyper-V Replica and to validate network connectivity between two sites.

trans-unit.source: System requirements
trans-unit.target: System requirements

trans-unit.source: Operating system: Windows Server® 2012 or Windows Server® 2012 R2
trans-unit.target: Operating system: Windows Server® 2012 or Windows Server® 2012 R2

trans-unit.source: Memory: 20 MB (minimum)
trans-unit.target: Memory: 20 MB (minimum)

trans-unit.source: CPU: 5 percent overhead (minimum)
trans-unit.target: CPU: 5 percent overhead (minimum)

trans-unit.source: Disk space: 5 MB (minimum)
trans-unit.target: Disk space: 5 MB (minimum)

trans-unit.source: Tutorial steps
trans-unit.target: Tutorial steps

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Prepare the primary site
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Prepare the primary site

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Prepare the recovery site if your recovery site is on-premises
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Prepare the recovery site if your recovery site is on-premises

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Run the capacity planner tool
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Run the capacity planner tool

trans-unit.source: Step 4: Interpret the results
trans-unit.target: Step 4: Interpret the results

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Prepare the primary site
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Prepare the primary site

trans-unit.source: Make a list of all of the Hyper-V virtual machines that will need to be enabled for replication and the corresponding primary Hyper-V hosts/clusters.
trans-unit.target: Make a list of all of the Hyper-V virtual machines that will need to be enabled for replication and the corresponding primary Hyper-V hosts/clusters.

trans-unit.source: Group primary Hyper-V hosts and clusters into one of the following:
trans-unit.target: Group primary Hyper-V hosts and clusters into one of the following:

trans-unit.source: Windows Server® 2012 standalone servers
trans-unit.target: Windows Server® 2012 standalone servers

trans-unit.source: Windows Server® 2012 clusters
trans-unit.target: Windows Server® 2012 clusters

trans-unit.source: Windows Server® 2012 R2 standalone servers
trans-unit.target: Windows Server® 2012 R2 standalone servers

trans-unit.source: Windows Server® 2012 R2 clusters
trans-unit.target: Windows Server® 2012 R2 clusters

trans-unit.source: You will need to run the capacity planner tool once per standalone server group and once for each cluster.
trans-unit.target: You will need to run the capacity planner tool once per standalone server group and once for each cluster.

trans-unit.source: Enable remote access to WMI on all primary hosts and clusters.
trans-unit.target: Enable remote access to WMI on all primary hosts and clusters.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the right set of firewall rules and user permissions are set.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the right set of firewall rules and user permissions are set.

trans-unit.source: Enable performance monitoring on the primary hosts.
trans-unit.target: Enable performance monitoring on the primary hosts.

trans-unit.source: Open the Windows Firewall with the Advanced Security snapin, and then enable the following inbound rules:
trans-unit.target: Open the Windows Firewall with the Advanced Security snapin, and then enable the following inbound rules:

trans-unit.source: COM+ Network Access (DCOM-IN)
trans-unit.target: COM+ Network Access (DCOM-IN)

trans-unit.source: All rules in the Remote Event Log Management group
trans-unit.target: All rules in the Remote Event Log Management group

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Prepare the recovery site
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Prepare the recovery site

trans-unit.source: If you are using Azure as the recovery site, or your on-premises recovery site is not yet ready, then you can skip this section.
trans-unit.target: If you are using Azure as the recovery site, or your on-premises recovery site is not yet ready, then you can skip this section.

trans-unit.source: But if you skip it, you won't be able to measure the available bandwidth between the two sites.
trans-unit.target: But if you skip it, you won't be able to measure the available bandwidth between the two sites.

trans-unit.source: Identify the authentication method
trans-unit.target: Identify the authentication method

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: Kerberos: To be used when both the primary and recovery Hyper-V hosts are in the same domain or are in mutually trusted domains.
trans-unit.target: Kerberos: To be used when both the primary and recovery Hyper-V hosts are in the same domain or are in mutually trusted domains.

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: Certificate: To be used when primary and recovery Hyper-V hosts are in different domains.
trans-unit.target: Certificate: To be used when primary and recovery Hyper-V hosts are in different domains.

trans-unit.source: Certificates can be created using makecert.
trans-unit.target: Certificates can be created using makecert.

trans-unit.source: For information about the steps required to deploy certificates using this technique, see the <link><linkText>Hyper-V Replica Certificate Based Authentication - makecert</linkText><title></title></link> blog post.
trans-unit.target: For information about the steps required to deploy certificates using this technique, see the <link><linkText>Hyper-V Replica Certificate Based Authentication - makecert</linkText><title></title></link> blog post.

trans-unit.source: Identify a single Recovery Hyper-V host/cluster from the recovery site.
trans-unit.target: Identify a single Recovery Hyper-V host/cluster from the recovery site.

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: This recovery host/cluster will be used to replicate a dummy virtual machine, and to estimate the available bandwidth between the primary and secondary sites.
trans-unit.target: This recovery host/cluster will be used to replicate a dummy virtual machine, and to estimate the available bandwidth between the primary and secondary sites.

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: Recommended: Use a single recovery Hyper-V host for running the tests.
trans-unit.target: Recommended: Use a single recovery Hyper-V host for running the tests.

trans-unit.source: Prepare a single Hyper-V host as a recovery server
trans-unit.target: Prepare a single Hyper-V host as a recovery server

trans-unit.source: In Hyper-V Manager, click Hyper-V Settings in the Actions pane.
trans-unit.target: In Hyper-V Manager, click Hyper-V Settings in the Actions pane.

trans-unit.source: In the Hyper-V Settings dialog, click Replication Configuration.
trans-unit.target: In the Hyper-V Settings dialog, click Replication Configuration.

trans-unit.source: In the Details pane, select Enable this computer as a Replica server.
trans-unit.target: In the Details pane, select Enable this computer as a Replica server.

trans-unit.source: In the Autentication and ports section, select the authentication method you previously chose.
trans-unit.target: In the Autentication and ports section, select the authentication method you previously chose.

trans-unit.source: For either authentication method, specify the port to be used (the default ports are 80 for kerberos over HTTP and 443 for certificate-based authentication over HTTPS).
trans-unit.target: For either authentication method, specify the port to be used (the default ports are 80 for kerberos over HTTP and 443 for certificate-based authentication over HTTPS).

trans-unit.source: If you are using certificate-based authentication, click Select Certificate, and then provide the certificate information.
trans-unit.target: If you are using certificate-based authentication, click Select Certificate, and then provide the certificate information.

trans-unit.source: In the Authorization and Storage section, specify to allow any authenticated (primary) server to send replication data to this replica server.
trans-unit.target: In the Authorization and Storage section, specify to allow any authenticated (primary) server to send replication data to this replica server.

trans-unit.source: Click OK or Apply.
trans-unit.target: Click OK or Apply.

trans-unit.source: Validate that the https listener is running by executing the command:
trans-unit.target: Validate that the https listener is running by executing the command:

trans-unit.source: netsh http show servicestate
trans-unit.target: netsh http show servicestate

trans-unit.source: Open firewall ports:
trans-unit.target: Open firewall ports:

trans-unit.source: Prepare a single Hyper-V cluster as a recovery target
trans-unit.target: Prepare a single Hyper-V cluster as a recovery target

trans-unit.source: If you have already prepared a standalone Hyper-V host a recovery server, then you can skip this section.
trans-unit.target: If you have already prepared a standalone Hyper-V host a recovery server, then you can skip this section.

trans-unit.source: Configure Hyper-V Replica broker:
trans-unit.target: Configure Hyper-V Replica broker:

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: In Server Manager, open Failover Cluster Manager.
trans-unit.target: In Server Manager, open Failover Cluster Manager.

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: In the left pane, connect to the cluster, and while the cluster name is highlighted, click Configure Role in the Actions pane.
trans-unit.target: In the left pane, connect to the cluster, and while the cluster name is highlighted, click Configure Role in the Actions pane.

trans-unit.source: This opens the High Availability wizard.
trans-unit.target: This opens the High Availability wizard.

trans-unit.source: c.
trans-unit.target: c.

trans-unit.source: In the Select Role screen, select Hyper-V Replica Broker.
trans-unit.target: In the Select Role screen, select Hyper-V Replica Broker.

trans-unit.source: d.
trans-unit.target: d.

trans-unit.source: Complete the wizard, providing a NetBIOS name and IP address to be used as the connection point to the cluster (called a client access point).
trans-unit.target: Complete the wizard, providing a NetBIOS name and IP address to be used as the connection point to the cluster (called a client access point).

trans-unit.source: The Hyper-V Replica Broker is configured, resulting in a client access point name.
trans-unit.target: The Hyper-V Replica Broker is configured, resulting in a client access point name.

trans-unit.source: Make a note of the client access point name - you will use it to configure the replica later on.
trans-unit.target: Make a note of the client access point name - you will use it to configure the replica later on.

trans-unit.source: e.
trans-unit.target: e.

trans-unit.source: Verify that the Hyper-V Replica Broker role comes online successfully and can fail over between all nodes of the cluster.
trans-unit.target: Verify that the Hyper-V Replica Broker role comes online successfully and can fail over between all nodes of the cluster.

trans-unit.source: To do this, right click the role, point to Move, and then click Select Node.
trans-unit.target: To do this, right click the role, point to Move, and then click Select Node.

trans-unit.source: Select a node > OK.
trans-unit.target: Select a node > OK.

trans-unit.source: f.
trans-unit.target: f.

trans-unit.source: If you use certificate-based authentication, ensure that each cluster node and the Hyper-V Replica Broker's client access point all have the certificate installed.
trans-unit.target: If you use certificate-based authentication, ensure that each cluster node and the Hyper-V Replica Broker's client access point all have the certificate installed.

trans-unit.source: Configure replica settings:
trans-unit.target: Configure replica settings:

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: In Server Manager, open Failover Cluster Manager.
trans-unit.target: In Server Manager, open Failover Cluster Manager.

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: In the left pane, connect to the cluster, and while the cluster name is highlighted, click Roles in the Navigate category of the Details pane.
trans-unit.target: In the left pane, connect to the cluster, and while the cluster name is highlighted, click Roles in the Navigate category of the Details pane.

trans-unit.source: c.
trans-unit.target: c.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the role, and then choose Replication Settings.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the role, and then choose Replication Settings.

trans-unit.source: d.
trans-unit.target: d.

trans-unit.source: In the Details pane, select Enable this cluster as a Replica Server.
trans-unit.target: In the Details pane, select Enable this cluster as a Replica Server.

trans-unit.source: e.
trans-unit.target: e.

trans-unit.source: In the Authentication and ports section, select the authentication method you chose earlier.
trans-unit.target: In the Authentication and ports section, select the authentication method you chose earlier.

trans-unit.source: For either authentication method, specify the port to be used (the default ports are 80 for Kerberos over HTTP, and 443 for certificate-based authentication over HTTPS).
trans-unit.target: For either authentication method, specify the port to be used (the default ports are 80 for Kerberos over HTTP, and 443 for certificate-based authentication over HTTPS).

trans-unit.source: f.
trans-unit.target: f.

trans-unit.source: If you are using certificate-based authentication, click Select Certificate, and then provide the reqeusted certificate information.
trans-unit.target: If you are using certificate-based authentication, click Select Certificate, and then provide the reqeusted certificate information.

trans-unit.source: g.
trans-unit.target: g.

trans-unit.source: In the Authorization and storage section, specify whether to allow any authenticated (primary) server to send replication data to this replica server or to limit acceptance to data from specific primary servers.
trans-unit.target: In the Authorization and storage section, specify whether to allow any authenticated (primary) server to send replication data to this replica server or to limit acceptance to data from specific primary servers.

trans-unit.source: You can use wildcard characters to limit acceptance to servers from a particular domain without having to specify them each individually (for example, *.contoso.com).
trans-unit.target: You can use wildcard characters to limit acceptance to servers from a particular domain without having to specify them each individually (for example, *.contoso.com).

trans-unit.source: h.
trans-unit.target: h.

trans-unit.source: Open firewall ports on all recovery Hyper-V hosts:
trans-unit.target: Open firewall ports on all recovery Hyper-V hosts:

trans-unit.source: Port 443 (Certificate auth):
trans-unit.target: Port 443 (Certificate auth):

trans-unit.source: Get-ClusterNode | ForEach-Object {Invoke-command -computername \$\_.name -scriptblock {Enable-Netfirewallrule -displayname "Hyper-V Replica HTTPS Listener (TCP-In)"}}
trans-unit.target: Get-ClusterNode | ForEach-Object {Invoke-command -computername \$\_.name -scriptblock {Enable-Netfirewallrule -displayname "Hyper-V Replica HTTPS Listener (TCP-In)"}}

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Run the capacity planner tool
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Run the capacity planner tool

trans-unit.source: Download the Capacity Planner tool.
trans-unit.target: Download the Capacity Planner tool.

trans-unit.source: Run the tool from one of the primary servers (or one of the nodes from the primary cluster).
trans-unit.target: Run the tool from one of the primary servers (or one of the nodes from the primary cluster).

trans-unit.source: Right-click the .exe file, and then choose Run as administrator.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the .exe file, and then choose Run as administrator.

trans-unit.source: If you choose, accept the Terms of License, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: If you choose, accept the Terms of License, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: Select a Duration for metric collection.
trans-unit.target: Select a Duration for metric collection.

trans-unit.source: It is highly recommended that the tool runs during production hours to ensure that the most representative data is collected.
trans-unit.target: It is highly recommended that the tool runs during production hours to ensure that the most representative data is collected.

trans-unit.source: The suggested duration for metric collection is 30 minutes.
trans-unit.target: The suggested duration for metric collection is 30 minutes.

trans-unit.source: If you're only trying to validate network connectivity, you can choose one minute as the duration.
trans-unit.target: If you're only trying to validate network connectivity, you can choose one minute as the duration.

trans-unit.source: Specify the Primary site details, as shown, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: Specify the Primary site details, as shown, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: For a standalone host, enter the server name or FQDN.
trans-unit.target: For a standalone host, enter the server name or FQDN.

trans-unit.source: If your Primary host is part of a cluster, you can enter FQDN of one of the following:
trans-unit.target: If your Primary host is part of a cluster, you can enter FQDN of one of the following:

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: The Hyper-V Replica Broker Client Access Point (CAP)
trans-unit.target: The Hyper-V Replica Broker Client Access Point (CAP)

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: The cluster name
trans-unit.target: The cluster name

trans-unit.source: c.
trans-unit.target: c.

trans-unit.source: Any node of the cluster
trans-unit.target: Any node of the cluster

trans-unit.source: Enter the Replica site details (on-premises site to on-premises site replication only)
trans-unit.target: Enter the Replica site details (on-premises site to on-premises site replication only)

trans-unit.source: If you want to enable replication to Azure or you didn't prepare a Hyper-V host or cluster as a recovery server (as explained in Step 2), you should skip test involving the replica site.
trans-unit.target: If you want to enable replication to Azure or you didn't prepare a Hyper-V host or cluster as a recovery server (as explained in Step 2), you should skip test involving the replica site.

trans-unit.source: Specify the Replica site details, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: Specify the Replica site details, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: i.
trans-unit.target: i.

trans-unit.source: For a standalone host, enter the server name or FQDN
trans-unit.target: For a standalone host, enter the server name or FQDN

trans-unit.source: ii.
trans-unit.target: ii.

trans-unit.source: If your Primary host is part of a cluster, you can enter FQDN of one of the following:
trans-unit.target: If your Primary host is part of a cluster, you can enter FQDN of one of the following:

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: The Hyper-V Replica Broker Client Access Point (CAP)
trans-unit.target: The Hyper-V Replica Broker Client Access Point (CAP)

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: The cluster name
trans-unit.target: The cluster name

trans-unit.source: c.
trans-unit.target: c.

trans-unit.source: Any node of the cluster
trans-unit.target: Any node of the cluster

trans-unit.source: Skip the tests involving Extended Replica site.
trans-unit.target: Skip the tests involving Extended Replica site.

trans-unit.source: They are not supported by ASR.
trans-unit.target: They are not supported by ASR.

trans-unit.source: Select the virtual machines to profile.
trans-unit.target: Select the virtual machines to profile.

trans-unit.source: The tool connects to the cluster or standalone servers specified in Primary Site Details, and enumerates the virtual machines that are running.
trans-unit.target: The tool connects to the cluster or standalone servers specified in Primary Site Details, and enumerates the virtual machines that are running.

trans-unit.source: Select the virtual machines and virtual disks for which you want metrics to be collected.
trans-unit.target: Select the virtual machines and virtual disks for which you want metrics to be collected.

trans-unit.source: The following virtual machines will not be enumerated or shown:
trans-unit.target: The following virtual machines will not be enumerated or shown:

trans-unit.source: Virtual machines that have already been enabled for replication
trans-unit.target: Virtual machines that have already been enabled for replication

trans-unit.source: Virtual machines that are not running
trans-unit.target: Virtual machines that are not running

trans-unit.source: Enter Network information (this is applicable only to on-premises site to on-premises site replication and when replica site details are provided).
trans-unit.target: Enter Network information (this is applicable only to on-premises site to on-premises site replication and when replica site details are provided).

trans-unit.source: Specify the requested network information, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: Specify the requested network information, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: Estimated WAN bandwidth
trans-unit.target: Estimated WAN bandwidth

trans-unit.source: The certificate to be used for authentication (optional): If you plan to use certificate-based authentication, you should provide the required certificates on this page.
trans-unit.target: The certificate to be used for authentication (optional): If you plan to use certificate-based authentication, you should provide the required certificates on this page.

trans-unit.source: On the next set of screens, click Next to start the tool.
trans-unit.target: On the next set of screens, click Next to start the tool.

trans-unit.source: When the tool is done running, click View Report to review the output.
trans-unit.target: When the tool is done running, click View Report to review the output.

trans-unit.source: Default report location:
trans-unit.target: Default report location:

trans-unit.source: %systemdrive%\Users\Public\Documents\Capacity Planner
trans-unit.target: %systemdrive%\Users\Public\Documents\Capacity Planner

trans-unit.source: Logs location:
trans-unit.target: Logs location:

trans-unit.source: %systemdrive%\Users\Public\Documents\CapacityPlanner
trans-unit.target: %systemdrive%\Users\Public\Documents\CapacityPlanner

trans-unit.source: Step 4: Interpret the results
trans-unit.target: Step 4: Interpret the results

trans-unit.source: You can ignore metrics which are not listed under one of the following two scenarios, as they are not relevant for this scenario.
trans-unit.target: You can ignore metrics which are not listed under one of the following two scenarios, as they are not relevant for this scenario.

trans-unit.source: On-premises site to on-premises site replication
trans-unit.target: On-premises site to on-premises site replication

trans-unit.source: Impact of replication on the primary host's compute, memory
trans-unit.target: Impact of replication on the primary host's compute, memory

trans-unit.source: Impact of replication on the primary, recovery hosts's storage disk space, IOPS
trans-unit.target: Impact of replication on the primary, recovery hosts's storage disk space, IOPS

trans-unit.source: Total bandwidth required for delta replication (Mbps)
trans-unit.target: Total bandwidth required for delta replication (Mbps)

trans-unit.source: Observed network bandwidth between the primary host and the recovery host (Mbps)
trans-unit.target: Observed network bandwidth between the primary host and the recovery host (Mbps)

trans-unit.source: Suggestion for the ideal number of active parallel transfers between the two hosts/clusters
trans-unit.target: Suggestion for the ideal number of active parallel transfers between the two hosts/clusters

trans-unit.source: On-premises site to Azure replication
trans-unit.target: On-premises site to Azure replication

trans-unit.source: Impact of replication on the primary host's compute, memory
trans-unit.target: Impact of replication on the primary host's compute, memory

trans-unit.source: Impact of replication on the primary host's storage disk space, IOPS
trans-unit.target: Impact of replication on the primary host's storage disk space, IOPS

trans-unit.source: Total bandwidth required for delta replication (Mbps)
trans-unit.target: Total bandwidth required for delta replication (Mbps)

trans-unit.target: More detailed guidance can be found on the <link><linkText>Capacity Planner for Hyper-V Replica download page</linkText><title></title></link>.
